resources.string: Must be 6 characters only letters and numbers
What if I can\'t see the vehicle license plate or there is no license plate?
Unless you are able to get the VIN # etched into the glass of one of the vehicle’s windows, unfortunately there is currently no way to report a vehicle without a license plate.
Out-of-state license plates can be entered just like an in-state license plate; simply select the state from the drop-down menu on the report form.
What if it is a license plate from a foreign country?

You can submit a report for a license plate from a foreign country (including diplomatic license plates) by selecting “Other - Foreign Country” from the drop-down menu and type the name of the country in the “Notes” field on the report form.
What if I am unsure of one digit/character of the license plate?
You can enter your best guess in the license plate # field, and in the “Notes” field, specify which digit/character you are unsure about or what else you think that digit/character could have been.
What if it is out-of-state license plate?\t
